doc.after: In response to the high oil prices of the 1970s industrial nations took steps to reduce dependence on oil Utilities switched to using coal natural gas or nuclear power while national governments initiated multi billion dollar research programs to develop alternatives to oil Demand for oil dropped by five million barrels a day while oil production outside of OPEC rose by fourteen million barrels daily by 1986 During this time the percentage of oil produced by OPEC fell from 50 to 29 The result was a six year price decline that culminated with a 46 percent price drop in 1986
